note.p: Biographer. Medical diploma, Edinburgh University, 1832. Editor, Leeds Times, 1838–42. Assistant secretary, Leeds and Thirsk Railway, 1845–54; secretary, South Eastern Railway, 1854–66. President, National Provident Institution, from 1866. Wrote self-help books and biographies.

note.term: biographies of industrial leaders and self-taught students of humble origin
